channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Labour says it is ‘deplorable’ for Reform to dismiss Farage schoolboy racism claims as lies – UK politics live
item.description: Reform UK deputy leader Richard Tice has claimed that allegations against Farage are ‘nonsense’ from people with ‘a political axe to grind’ Nigel Fara...

item.title: Putin is ‘morally responsible’ for Dawn Sturgess’s novichok death, inquiry finds
item.description: ‘Overwhelming’ evidence that Russian state planned attack on ex-spy Sergei Skripal that led to Sturgess’s death in 2018, says chair Vladimir Putin is ...

item.title: Fossil-fuel billionaires bought up millions of shares after meeting with top Trump officials
item.description: Co-founders’ acquisition of Venture Global shares before key permit granted draws scrutiny as pair deny wrongdoing Two fossil-fuel billionaires with c...

item.title: Rachel Reeves will not be investigated over pre-budget briefing, FCA says
item.description: Financial regulator leaves door open for follow-up as rejects calls for formal inquiry into claims against Treasury officials Treasury launches inquir...

item.title: Killing of survivors sparks outrage – but entire US ‘drug boat’ war is legally shaky
item.description: Pentagon’s Law of War manual clearly prohibits attack, but justification for whole campaign also faces tough questions Graphic depictions of two survi...

item.title: Household bills will rise to fund £28bn investment in energy network
item.description: Ofgem says the investment will help lower reliance on imported gas and make wholesale energy cheaper.

item.title: Crypto investor donates record £9m to Reform UK
item.description: The sum from Christopher Harborne is the largest ever single donation by a living person to a British political party.

item.title: UK and Norway form naval alliance to hunt Russian submarines
item.description: The partnership is designed to protect undersea cables, which Western officials say are increasingly under threat from Moscow.

item.title: Root's first ton in Australia keeps England afloat
item.description: Joe Root finally makes a century in Australia to keep England afloat on a riveting first day of the second Ashes Test in Brisbane.

item.title: Hospitals facing unprecedented flu season, say NHS bosses
item.description: Record number of patients in hospital in England with flu for this time of year, figures show.
